data.title: Visual shader editor node selection and position issues
data.body: **Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):** macOS: 10.12.5 macbook pro (retina) godot: 2.1.3 and 2.1.4 **Issue description:** - After adding a node, several nodes will be randomly selected. (2.1.3 and 2.1.4) - Randomly, when selecting a node or making a connection, several other nodes will be selected. (2.1.3 and 2.1.4) - Sometimes, you cannot deselect a node. (2.1.4, haven't replicated on 2.1.3) - When panning, if a node is selected, the node moves as well. (2.1.4) - After deleting a node, several random nodes are selected. When the mouse moves all of the selected nodes are repositioned on top of each-other. (2.1.3 and 2.1.4) - Node positions are hidpi dependent. Meaning, if I organize my graph on a retina display, then open godot on a normal display, the nodes are 2x further apart from each-other. (only tested on 2.1.4, will have to test 2.1.3 when I have my other monitor again) (Example of post-delete repositioning)

data.title: Fix crash when editing SampleLibrary with broken dependencies
data.body: Fixes #9466

data.title: Shadeless materials are now shaded
data.body:
As the title suggests, materials that should be unshaded are now shaded:
1) ShaderMaterial with the "unshaded" render_mode
2) SpatialMaterials with the unshaded flag
3) Sprite3Ds with shaded unchecked
4) gizmos

This was introduced in the last day or two.  My money is on: e611ff5f0110210221a6f90250bdd65f5fb3ff2d but I haven't looked into it.

data.title: Fix UNIX file open
data.body:
In #10973 I refactored FileAccessUnix::_open() but I accidentally made
it impossible to create new files.

This fixes that and fixes #10984

Sorry guys... ðŸ¥‡ for me

**Issue description:**
in the kinematic character demo (2D) the kinematic body does not slide down slopes.   In the kinematic character 3D demo if you rotate the tilemap slightly the character slides down the slope.   I was expecting that there would be some simple solution to sliding on slopes or maybe that the move_and_slide command would not allow for sliding by default. 


**Steps to reproduce:**
take the kinematic character 3D demo. Rotate the tilemap slightly. Run the game.  Cubio slides down the slope.

data.title: In 2.1.4, can't pause a debugged game, and the debugger seems to believe it still runs after closing
data.body:
Godot 2.1.4 stable
Windows 10 64 bits

Unlike 2.1.3, when I play a game, I cannot pause it:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/30038829-4b3b56b6-91c9-11e7-8c28-2fb35533f190.png)

Unlike 2.1.3, when I stop the game, the editor believes it still run, if I close with window close button or the ingame Exit button:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/30038843-784b1b28-91c9-11e7-9755-f61a1f4d2ebe.png)

The game also takes longer to start (about 3 seconds delay, while in 2.1.3 it's close to 1 second only).

data.title: 3D selection issues
data.body:
Godot 3.0 master
Windows 10 64 bits

I ran into a few issues with selection behaviour in the 3D editor.
The test done is to recreate this scene mesh by mesh (ProceduralMeshes):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/30038442-e684f9a6-91c4-11e7-8095-ebf22f44d198.png)

1) I was unable to select the vertical quad in any way.

2) I was also unable to select the horizontal plane or the cube, but after some delay they became selectable, not sure why. That delay took between 1 to 30 seconds (while I was creating the scene mesh by mesh)

~~3) Rectangular selection doesn't select anything~~ Fixed by #10897

4) If done from lower-right to top-left, rectangular selection draws the rectangle backwards (and still doesn't select anything)

5) If I select a Spatial item, I can't select any other in the viewport even when clicking right on it. If I drag the mouse not on the axes, it still drags the object even though I'm not touching any gizmo.

data.title: GTX 950 vs RX 480 or Nvidia vs Radeon Issue?
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Any Godot Version, tested on them all. Even the latest branch.

**Issue description:**
So this issue is really hard to explain.

Basically, when previewing a scene in the editor or running Godot by the command line "godot -d Main.tscn", there is a delay **ONLY** on the **GTX 950** card.

I tested this on the EXACT same computer with updated drivers for both cards:
i7 7700k, Win 10 Pro 64-bit, RX 480: Previewing the scene = **instant**

i7 7700k, Win 10 Pro 64-bit, GTX 950: Previewing the scene = takes noticeably longer, example:

![](https://i.gyazo.com/35a437ca3c7cb15a58163dc31c1d522e.gif)

I spent all day yesterday messing with this and wondering why the difference is happening. I'm really stumped and don't know why, the only reason why I switched to the GTX 950 is because it plays better with Path of Exile. But then noticed the issue with Godot.

However, previewing scenes in Unity/Atomic and other game engines I have no issue at all with the GTX 950 card. I was thinking maybe the card is just bad for game development

data.title: Fixes setting visibility on GridMap, issue #907
data.body: Basically, `GridMap` wasn't reacting to the `NOTIFICATION_VISIBILITY_CHANGED` event. This reacts to such event and walks over the set of `Octants` and all of their `MultiMeshInstances` to set their visibility on the `VisualServer`.

data.title: Remove NULL check from Object::cast_to()
data.body:
After discussing this with @reduz on IRC we agreed to remove these
checks. We now consider cast_to() to be NULL safe

data.title: Multithreaded instancing performance (RID caching needs to be completed)
data.body:
Because of the recommendation from Zylann in the [Q&A Topic](https://godotengine.org/qa/17821/instancing-in-another-thread?show=17832#c17832)  I want to open the following issue:


**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Windows 10 64Bit, Godot 3.0 master-branch

**Issue description:**
Instancing (not counting loading the resource) Levelchunks from PackedScenes on another thread takes (dependent on the scene size) up to half a minute, while instancing them from the main-thread takes 10ms-ish. This makes level streaming in Godot not practical at 60fps without visible frame stutters. 

Chunking levels even smaller makes the overhead of loading too many small scenes not feasible. The only alternative way right now is to save scenes into a binary file manually storing only it's properties. Then when parsing the file again, applying the properties to a pre-instanced pool of nodes. 
But this defeats the purpose of the whole Godot nodes&scenes concept and Editor tooling. 

**Steps to reproduce:**

Start a thread and instance any scene and time it, compare to instancing with main thread.

data.title: Issues with the new white theme
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
3873362b3df0c1c03746225f8e43b629bd0864cc


**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
There are some issues and some concerns about the new white theme. ping @toger5 

first the issues (should be easy to solve):
1. The icons generation time is increased, as i suspected, the color replacement takes some time, so according to my measurements, the icon generation time for the white theme is 0.37 s whereas for the dark theme is 0.26 s, i know it is not much of a increase but this time is added to the editor and project manager boot time, (it should be less with release mode), (also there is room for optimization in color replacement).

2. visual issues: the ones i found so far
![screenshot from 2017-09-04 13-05-07](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1103897/30035756-04132ee0-9173-11e7-85fa-965a6e193be9.png)
![screenshot from 2017-09-04 13-05-35](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1103897/30035762-07c4c7c4-9173-11e7-97df-0a56fa9ada3a.png)
![screenshot from 2017-09-04 13-05-55](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1103897/30035764-09968d58-9173-11e7-836f-167d7a27505f.png)

3. this is not related with white theme, but it is a change introduced by it
contrast_colorx for variable naming is not very good, the thing is that there are just to variant for contrast
dark and light, thats way more explicit than, since usually you dont choose full black or **full white** as base color

4. white as a base color might no be a good idea.
white should not be used as base theme,  because you are loosing the light contrast variation, instead a more greyish color should be used (people can still set that as a base color, but with poor results).



concerns (should be a little harder to solve):
My main concern about supporting the white theme, is that now we have to focus in making sure that everything we do works on light and dark themes (this is hard), there are several hardcoded colors, and several style rules, also element that were designed for a dark theme do not match exaclty when presented on dark themes (and vice-versa), increased effort in new visual features, now we have to test on both variations (something that apparently has not been done so far). @toger5 i know you use the light theme, and when you do changes you focus mostly on the white theme, and i do stuff for the dark theme (which is the official flavor). so @toger5 we have to figure out a way to avoid throwing dirt on each other (meaning when you fix something for light, it breaks something for dark and vice-versa). also first and foremost we have to focus our efforts in the official flavor (which is dark).




**Steps to reproduce:**


**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

data.title: Problem with custom_sort
data.body:
Hello, 

I'm on Windows 10 with godot 2.1.4

OK, so on my computer there is a bug with custom_sort. And its a very strange bug. Because it doesn't always happen, or its sometimes different in the way it happens. So I wrote a table that you can sort columns. But sometimes I get an error when I try to sort a column.

The easiest way to reproduce the problem is to try to sort the third column first, before sorting any of the other columns. If you sort the third column after you sorted the first or the second sometimes it works out fine.

[SortTest.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1275295/SortTest.zip)

data.title: [Godot 3.0] Vector3 slide
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
All OS, Godot 3.0

**Issue description:**
Slide formular is wrong?
From [commit](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/1a620bd5faebd83015182ea032f40936a9916af6)

Formular was changed from:
`p_vec - *this * this->dot(p_vec)`
to:
`*this - p_normal * this->dot(p_normal)`

data.title: One Way Collisions in Tilemap
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Manjaro Linux , Godot 2.1.4 stable

**Issue description:**
When you set Oneway collision in a tile it works well inside Godot, but when u export the game to any plataform, like linux, windows, mac, android the collision change to normal.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Make a new scene, make your tiles, add a StaticBody2D and a CollisionShape2D or CollisionPolygon2D in your tiles. Set the StaticBody2D One Way Collisior to Direction (0,1) and Max Depth (1) , export your tiles to .tres, .res or .xml. Add a TileMap node in your main scene, draw your tilemap scene put a player int he scene, export the project to any plataform. 


**Link to minimal example project:**
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0By9n8Akl7DQ4OFBDMUNPc1Rtb00/view?usp=sharing

data.title: Godot Crashes On Start-Up if External Editor Cannot be Found
data.body:
**Operating system and Godot version:**
`Win10 x86_64` with `x86 Godot v2.1.4` from steam

**Issue description:**
Godot will crash if the external editor is unable to be located.  I encountered this bug after moving to Visual Studio Code x64.


**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Enable an external editor
1. Move or delete the editor *.exe
1. Run Godot and open a project
1. Editor will freeze and crash

**Fixed by:**
Manually editing the `editor_data/editor_settings.tres`

data.title: addon api - A way to access the currently selected frame in the SpriteFrames editor and get its path
data.body:
I am trying to write an addon that lets the user open an image file from the spritesheet editor with an external app - directly from godot.

to do that I have to get the name of the currently selected animation in the spritesheet editor, and also get the currently selected frame.

`get_selection().get_selected_nodes()[0].get_animation()) `
will always return the first animation, or whatever is set in the inspector, and not what I need - what the user has selected in the sprite sheet editor

There seems to be no way to access that information from the spritesheet editor via gdscript.

Is this possible to do at all, or is it a missing feature?

My end goal is to make an addon that lets godot create new image files and open them in any external editor - with a single command - as well as open existing images in sprites, spritesheets and any node that has them as a resource

I tried writing a pixel art tool addon, but abandoned it for now , since I got stuck at the eraser tool -godot is missing a blending mode that would allow me to implement an eraser tool in a clean way.
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/10255

So I decided to make an addon that would at least let me create and open images in an external editor by calling it from within godot - I want to make a way to have better integration of external tools with the resources within godot that are assigned to nodes -mainly png and other type of images.
I want to reduce the number of clicks required to get to them in an editing app to one or two
